intro: Fleischmannia guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan fleischmannia, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its succulent structure. Its flowers are often short-lived but attract pollinators such as bees and moths. Fleischmannia guatemalensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
